sen.j: 伊東祐亨（いとう すけゆき、天保14年5月12日 (旧暦)（1843年6月9日） - 1月16日）は、日本の武士、大日本帝国海軍軍人、華族。
sen.e: Sukeuki ITO (June 9, 1843 - January 16, 1914) was a samurai, a military man of the Imperial Japanese Navy, and a peerage.
Sukeyuki ITO (June 9, 1843 - January 16, 1914) was a samurai, a military man of the Imperial Japanese Navy and a peerage.
sen.cmt: 名前のスペルミスを修正しました。不要なコンマを削除しました。
sen.e: Sukeyuki ITO (June 9, 1843 - January 16, 1914) was a samurai, a military man of the Imperial Japanese Navy and a peerage.

sen.j: 元帥海軍大将・従一位・大勲位・功一級・伯爵。
sen.e: He served as the fleet admiral and received the honors of Junior First Rank, the supreme order, and the Ko-Ikkyu, and was given the title of a Count.
He served as the fleet admiral and received the honors of Junior First Rank, the supreme order, and the Ko-Ikkyu, and was given the title of a Count.
He served as the fleet admiral and received the honors of Junior First Rank, the supreme order, and the Ko-Ikkyu, and was given the title of a Count.

sen.j: 本人は「いとう ゆうこう」と称した。
sen.e: He called himself Yuko ITO.
He called himself Yuko ITO.
He called himself Yuko ITO.

sen.j: 幕末期の薩摩藩藩士。
sen.e: He was a member of the Satsuma clan during the end of the Edo period.
He was a member of the Satsuma clan during the end of the Edo period.
He was a member of the Satsuma clan during the end of the Edo period.

sen.j: 初代連合艦隊司令長官を務めた。
sen.e: He served as the first commander of the combined fleet.
He served as the first commander of the combined fleet.
He served as the first commander of the combined fleet.

sen.j: 仮名 (通称)は四郎左衛門、四郎。
sen.e: His common name was Shirozaemon or Shiro.
His common name was Shirozaemon or Shiro.
His common name was Shirozaemon or Shiro.

sen.j: 号は碧海。
sen.e: His pseudonym was Aomi.
His pseudonym was Aomi.
His pseudonym was Aomi.

sen.j: 海軍兵学校 (日本)長の海軍中将子爵伊東祐麿は兄。
sen.e: The vice admiral, Sukemaro ITO, who was a principal of the Naval Academy (Japan) as well as a Viscount, was his older brother.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The vice admiral, Sukemaro ITO, who was a principal of the Naval Academy (Japan) as well as a Viscount, was his older brother.
The vice admiral, Sukemaro ITO, who was a principal of the Naval Academy (Japan) as well as a Viscount, was his older brother.

sen.j: 弟に海軍大尉伊東祐道、海軍大佐窪田祐章。
sen.e: The naval lieutenant, Sukemichi ITO, and the naval captain, Sukeaki KUBOTA, were Sukeyuki's younger brothers.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The naval lieutenant, Sukemichi ITO, and the naval captain, Sukeaki KUBOTA, were Sukeyuki's younger brothers.
The naval lieutenant, Sukemichi ITO, and the naval captain, Sukeaki KUBOTA, were Sukeyuki's younger brothers.

sen.j: 家紋は庵木瓜。
sen.e: The family crest was the Iorimokko.
The family crest was the Iorimokko.
The family crest was the Iorimokko.

sen.j: 経歴
sen.e: His career
Career
sen.cmt: 用語統一リストに従い、修正しました。
sen.e: Career

sen.j: 薩摩藩士伊東祐典の四男として鹿児島市城下清水町に生まれる。
sen.e: He was born in Jyoka shimizu-cho, Kagoshima City as the fourth son of Sukenori ITO, a member of the Satsuma clan.
He was born in Jyoka shimizu-cho, Kagoshima City as the fourth son of Sukenori ITO, a member of the Satsuma clan.
He was born in Jyoka shimizu-cho, Kagoshima City as the fourth son of Sukenori ITO, a member of the Satsuma clan.

sen.j: 飫肥藩主伊東氏に連なる名門の出身である（伊東祐安の養子で弟の右衛門の子孫という）。
sen.e: He was a descendent of ITO family, the Lord of Obi clan (he was Sukeyasu ITO's adapted son and also a descendent of Sukeyasu's younger brother, Uemon).
He was a descendent of ITO family, the Lord of Obi clan (he was Sukeyasu ITO's adapted son and also a descendent of Sukeyasu's younger brother, Uemon).
He was a descendent of ITO family, the Lord of Obi clan (he was Sukeyasu ITO's adapted son and also a descendent of Sukeyasu's younger brother, Uemon).

sen.j: 開成所にてイギリスの学問を学んだ。
sen.e: Sukeyuki studied about England at the School of Western Learning.
Sukeyuki studied about England at the School of Western Learning.
Sukeyuki studied about England at the School of Western Learning.

sen.j: 当時、イギリスは世界でも有数の海軍力を擁していたため、このとき、祐亨は海軍に興味を持ったと言われている。
sen.e: At the time of his studies, the British Navy was one of the strongest in the world, which probably sparked his desire to learn about the Navy.
At the time of his studies, the British Navy was one of the strongest in the world, which probably sparked his desire to learn about the Navy.
At the time of his studies, the British Navy was one of the strongest in the world, which probably sparked his desire to learn about the Navy.

sen.j: 江川英龍のもとでは砲術を学び、勝海舟の神戸海軍操練所では塾頭の坂本龍馬、陸奥宗光らと共に航海術を学ぶ。
sen.e: He learned about gunnery while under the supervision of Hidetatsu EGAWA and he learned about seamanship with Ryoma SAKAMOTO, one of the school's managers, Munemitsu MUNE, and others at the Kobe Naval Training Center which was established by Kaishu KATSU.

He learned about gunnery while under the supervision of Hidetatsu EGAWA and he learned about seamanship with Ryoma SAKAMOTO, one of the school's managers, Munemitsu MUNE, and others at the Kobe Naval Training Center which was established by Kaishu KATSU.

He learned about gunnery while under the supervision of Hidetatsu EGAWA and he learned about seamanship with Ryoma SAKAMOTO, one of the school's managers, Munemitsu MUNE, and others at the Kobe Naval Training Center which was established by Kaishu KATSU.

sen.j: 薩英戦争にも従軍。
sen.e: He also participated in the Satsuei War.
He also participated in the Satsuei War.
He also participated in the Satsuei War.

sen.j: 鳥羽・伏見の戦い前の薩摩藩邸焼き討ち事件で江戸から脱出し、戊辰戦争では旧幕府海軍との戦いで活躍した。
sen.e: He escaped from Edo during the fire attack on the resident of Satsuma clan, which took place prior to the Battle of Toba-Fushime, and he played an active part in the battle against the old Bakufu Navy during the Boshin War.

He escaped from Edo during the fire attack on the resident of Satsuma clan, which took place prior to the Battle of Toba-Fushimi, and he played an active part in the battle against the old Bakufu Navy during the Boshin War.
sen.cmt: スペルミスを修正しました。
sen.e: He escaped from Edo during the fire attack on the resident of Satsuma clan, which took place prior to the Battle of Toba-Fushimi, and he played an active part in the battle against the old Bakufu Navy during the Boshin War.

sen.j: 明治維新後は、海軍に入り、明治4年（1871年）に海軍大尉に任官。
sen.e: After the Meiji Restoration, he joined the navy and was assigned the position of Lieutenant in 1871.
After the Meiji Restoration, he joined the navy and was assigned the position of Lieutenant in 1871.
After the Meiji Restoration, he joined the navy and was assigned the position of Lieutenant in 1871.

sen.j: には「日進 (巡洋艦)」の艦長に補せられた。
sen.e: In 1877, he became the captain of "Nisshin (a cruise)."
sen.cmt: 1877年が抜けていたので、補足しました。“補せられた”の意味がはっきりしません。
sen.e: In 1877, he became the captain of "Nisshin (a cruise)."
In 1877, he became the captain of "Nisshin (a cruise)."

sen.j: には海軍大佐に任官、「龍驤 (初代)」、「扶桑 (初代)」、「比叡 (コルベット)」の艦長を歴任する。
sen.e: In1882, he successively served as the naval captain of "Ryujyo (the First)," "Fuso (the First)," and "Hiei (a Corvette type)."
sen.cmt: 1882年が抜けていたので、補足しました。
sen.e: In1882, he successively served as the naval captain of "Ryujyo (the First)," "Fuso (the First)," and "Hiei (a Corvette type)."
In1882, he successively served as the naval captain of "Ryujyo (the First)," "Fuso (the First)," and "Hiei (a Corvette type)."

sen.j: 、横須賀造船所長兼横須賀鎮守府次長に補せられた。
sen.e: In 1885, he was assigned to be both head of the Yokosuka shipyard and assistant manager of Yokosuka Chinju-fu (a naval base).
sen.cmt: 1885年が抜けていたので、補足しました。“補せられた”の意味がはっきりしません。
sen.e: In 1885, he was assigned to be both a head of the Yokosuka shipyard and an assistant manager of Yokosuka Chinju-fu (a naval base).
In 1885, he was assigned to be both a head of the Yokosuka shipyard and an assistant manager of Yokosuka Chinju-fu (a naval base).

sen.j: 同年イギリスで建造中であった「浪速 (防護巡洋艦)」回航委員長となり、その就役後は艦長に任じられ、に海軍少将に進む。
sen.e: In the same year, he was appointed chairman of the "Naniwa (a guard cruiser)," then to the position of captain after his role as chaiman was completed, and then he became rear admiral of the navy.

In the same year, he was appointed chairman of the "Naniwa (a guard cruiser)" which had been building in England, then to the position of captain after his role as chaiman was completed, and then he became rear admiral of the navy.
sen.cmt: 訳抜けがありましたので追加しました。
sen.e: In the same year, he was appointed chairman of the "Naniwa (a guard cruiser)" which had been building in England, then to the position of captain after his role as chaiman was completed, and then he became rear admiral of the navy.

sen.j: のち海軍省海軍省軍務局長兼海軍大学校校長を経て、には海軍中将に任官、横須賀鎮守府長官を拝命。
sen.e: In 1892, he was appointed vice admiral of the Navy and director of the Yokosuka Chinju-fu (naval base) after serving as director of the Military Affairs Bureau at the Naval Ministry and principal of the Naval War College.
sen.cmt: 1892年が抜けていたので、補足しました。
sen.e: In 1892, he was appointed a vice admiral of the Navy and a director of the Yokosuka Chinju-fu (naval base) after serving as a director of the Military Affairs Bureau at the Naval Ministry and principal of the Naval War College.

In 1892, he was appointed a vice admiral of the Navy and a director of the Yokosuka Chinju-fu (naval base) after serving as a director of the Military Affairs Bureau at the Naval Ministry and principal of the Naval War College.

sen.j: に常備艦隊長官を拝命し、の日清戦争に際し、7月18日連合艦隊司令長官を拝命した。
sen.e: In 1893 he was appointed director of a standing fleet, and then on July 18 of 1894, he was appointed director of combined fleet during the Nissin War.
sen.cmt: 1893,1894年が抜けていたので、補足しました。
sen.e: In 1893 he was appointed a director of a standing fleet, and then on July 18 of 1894, he was appointed a director of combined fleet during the Nissin War.
In 1893 he was appointed a director of a standing fleet, and then on July 18 of 1894, he was appointed a director of combined fleet during the Nissin War.

sen.j: 日本の連合艦隊と中国清朝の北洋水師（中国北洋艦隊）との間に黄海上で9月17日12時50分より行われた黄海海戦 (日清戦争)で、黄海の制海権を確保した。
sen.e: The Japanese Combined Fleet secured command over the Yellow sea after defeating the North Sea-Suishi (an old word for the Navy) of the Qing Dynasty (the China North Sea fleet) during the battle of Kokai Kaisen (a naval battle that took place at the mouth of the Yalu River) which started at 12:50 on September 17.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The Japanese Combined Fleet secured command over the Yellow sea after defeating the North Sea-Suishi (an old word for the Navy) of the Qing Dynasty (the China North Sea fleet) during the battle of Kokai Kaisen (a naval battle that took place at the mouth of the Yalu River) which started at 12:50 on September 17.
sen.cmt: 不要なスペースを削除しました。
sen.e: The Japanese Combined Fleet secured command over the Yellow sea after defeating the North Sea-Suishi (an old word for the Navy) of the Qing Dynasty (the China North Sea fleet) during the battle of Kokai Kaisen (a naval battle that took place at the mouth of the Yalu River) which started at 12:50 on September 17.

sen.j: 日本側の旗艦「松島 (巡洋艦)」の4217tに対し、清国側の旗艦「定遠 (戦艦)」は7220tと、倍近い差があった。
sen.e: The size of "Matsushima (a cruser)," a flagship, was only 4217t, one half of the flagship of Qing, "Teien (a battleship)," which was 7220t
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The size of "Matsushima" (a cruiser), a flagship, was only 4217t, one half of the flagship of Qing, "Teien" (a battleship), which was 7220t
sen.cmt: （）の説明を""の外に出しました。またスペルミスを修正しました。
sen.e: The size of "Matsushima" (a cruiser), a flagship, was only 4217t, one half of the flagship of Qing, "Teien" (a battleship), which was 7220t

sen.j: そして、戦前の予想を覆し、中国側の大型主力艦を撃破した。
sen.e: And contrary to the pre-war expectation, Japanese Combined Fleet defeated the Chinese large-sized main fleet.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: And contrary to the pre-war expectation, Japanese Combined Fleet defeated the Chinese large-sized main fleet.
And contrary to the pre-war expectation, Japanese Combined Fleet defeated the Chinese large-sized main fleet.

sen.j: この戦いは日清戦争の展開を日本に有利にする重大な転回点であった。
sen.e: This battle was a turning point for Japan which allowed Japan to gain control over the Nisshin War.
This battle was a turning point for Japan which allowed Japan to gain control over the Nisshin War.
This battle was a turning point for Japan which allowed Japan to gain control over the Nisshin War.

sen.j: 中国艦隊はその後も抵抗を続けたが、陸上での敗色もあり、北洋艦隊提督の丁汝昌は降伏を決めた。
sen.e: The Chinese fleet continued to fight, however, before long, Jyosho TEI, the admiral of the Chinese North Sea fleet, decided to surrender.
The Chinese fleet continued to fight, however, before long, Jyosho TEI, the admiral of the Chinese North Sea fleet, decided to surrender.
The Chinese fleet continued to fight, however, before long, Jyosho TEI, the admiral of the Chinese North Sea fleet, decided to surrender.

sen.j: 2月13日に威海市で北洋艦隊は降伏。
sen.e: On Feburary 13, the China North Sea fleet fnally surrendered at Ikai City.
On February 13, the China North Sea fleet finally surrendered at Ikai City.
sen.cmt: スペルミスを修正しました。
sen.e: On February 13, the China North Sea fleet finally surrendered at Ikai City.

sen.j: 丁汝昌自身はその前日、服毒死を遂げた。
sen.e: The day before the surrender, Jyosho TEI committed suicide after consuming poison.
The day before the surrender, Jyosho TEI committed suicide after consuming poison.
The day before the surrender, Jyosho TEI committed suicide after consuming poison.

sen.j: 伊東は没収した艦船の中から商船「康済号」を外し、丁汝昌の遺体を送らせ、世界をその礼節で驚嘆せしめた。
sen.e: ITO won the nation's admiration after he returned the body of Syosho TEI to China using one of the Chinese fleet's confiscated ships, the merchant ship, "Kozaigo."
ITO won the nation's admiration after he returned the body of Syosho TEI to China using one of the Chinese fleet's confiscated ships, the merchant ship, "Kozaigo."
ITO won the nation's admiration after he returned the body of Syosho TEI to China using one of the Chinese fleet's confiscated ships, the merchant ship, "Kozaigo."

sen.j: 戦争後は軍令部を務め、に海軍大将に進んだ。
sen.e: After the end of the war, he was appointed to the admiral in the Navy in 1898 after serving as the manager of the military command.
sen.cmt: 1898年が抜けていたので、補足しました。軍令部長の”長”が抜けていました。
sen.e: After the end of the war, he was appointed to the admiral in the Navy in 1898 after serving as the manager of the military command.
After the end of the war, he was appointed to the admiral in the Navy in 1898 after serving as the manager of the military command.

sen.j: 日露戦争では軍令部長として大本営に勤め、の終戦の後は元帥 (日本)に任じられた。
sen.e: He served as the manager of military command in the main headquarters during the Russo-Japanese War and was appointed to Japanese fleet admiral after the war in 1905.
sen.cmt: 1905年が抜けていたので、補足しました。
sen.e: He served as the manager of military command in the main headquarters during the Russo-Japanese War and was appointed to Japanese fleet admiral after the war in 1905.
sen.cmt: 不要なスペースを削除しました。
sen.e: He served as the manager of military command in the main headquarters during the Russo-Japanese War and was appointed to Japanese fleet admiral after the war in 1905.

sen.j: 政治権力には一切の興味を示さず、軍人としての生涯をまっとうした。
sen.e: His life was spent serving as a military man and he neglected any interest in acquiring political power.
He spent his life serving as a military man and he neglected any interest in acquiring political power.
sen.cmt: 自然な流れになるよう表現を修正しました。
sen.e: He spent his life serving as a military man and he neglected any interest in acquiring political power.

sen.j: には伯爵に叙せられた。
sen.e: He became a count.
sen.cmt: 1907年が抜けていたので、補足しました。
sen.e: He was given a count in 1907.
sen.cmt: 翻訳者のcommentにあった年号の補足がなかったため追加しました。またより明確な表現に修正しました。
sen.e: He was given a count in 1907.

sen.j: 従一位功一級金鵄勲章、大勲位菊花大綬章を授与される。
sen.e: He received the Junior First Rank, the Ko Ikkyu, Grand Cordon of the Supreme Order of the Chrysanthemum.
He received the Junior First Rank, the Ko Ikkyu, Grand Cordon of the Supreme Order of the Chrysanthemum.
He received the Junior First Rank, the Ko Ikkyu, Grand Cordon of the Supreme Order of the Chrysanthemum.

sen.j: 、72歳で死去した。
sen.e: He died at the age of 72.
He died at the age of 72.
He died at the age of 72.
